ceidkeeper@... wrote:

> If i dont do the set classpath command i get
> 
> Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
> junit/textui/TestRunner

Well, of course: if you don't set the class path, then the Java 
interpreter won't find anything. You learn that on day one of Java.

> Any idea what am i doing wrong???
> Any way that the set classpath command can be loaded at any time?

Don't use the CLASSPATH environment variable. Use the -classpath switch 
of the Java interpreter, instead. Please search the web for a tutorial.

java -classpath c:\junit\junit.jar;c:\junit junit.textui.TestRunner ...
